title: Change in Employee Parking Policy
content:
To all employees,

This notice is to inform you of an upcoming change to the employee parking policy at our office building. Due to recent renovations and an increase in the number of tenants, parking availability has become more limited than before. As a result, adjustments are necessary to ensure fair and efficient use of the parking facilities.

Starting next month, employee parking permits will be reassigned based on work schedules and job roles. Employees who work night shifts or frequently travel for business will be given priority access to on-site parking spaces. Others may be asked to use nearby public parking areas or alternative transportation methods.

Employees who wish to request a parking permit must submit an application form by the end of this month. Forms can be downloaded from the internal website and should be sent to the Human Resources Department after completion.

Please note that parking in unauthorized areas may result in penalties, including warnings or fines. Clear signs will be posted throughout the parking area to indicate permitted zones.

If you have questions regarding this change, please contact the Human Resources Department for further information.

questions.body: Who will be given priority for on-site parking spaces?
choices_text: Employees who arrive early in the morning
Employees who work night shifts or travel often
